vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ὕσσωπος, ἡ,
hyssop, Origanum hirtum, Hebrew 'ēzōb, [NT+5th c.BC+]:—also ὕσσωπον, τό, [Refs 1st c.AD+]; compare ὑσωπίς. (Written ὑσω- in [Refs 1st c.AD+] [same places] (hyso-), [NT+2nd c.AD+]; ὑσσω- in [Refs] and frequently in codices; ὑσσ- is a long syllable in [Refs 2nd c.BC+] [same places]; genitive written ἱσσύπου in [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: hyssop, highly aromatic leaves used in purification rites and at Passover
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
hyssop, highly aromatic leaves used in purification rites and at Passover
hyssop, in NT, however, not the plant usually so named, but probably the caper plant; a bunch of hyssop, Heb. 9:19; a hyssop stalk, Jn. 19:29*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: hisopo (arbusto pequeño con hojas aromáticas usadas para aspersiones rituales)
